intro: Cerastium eriophorum f. macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers, which are typically borne in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. This variety is distinguished by its larger, more showy flowers compared to the typical form of Cerastium eriophorum.
